attributes.additional_details:
With the increase in online and other distance selling of products there's an increase in the use of couriers and delivery companies.
Currently there is no requirement for a retailer to inform you which company will be used nor give you a choice.
Consequently some purchasers never receive their product or have to waste time chasing for deliveries.
For example you may know that courier A is awful in your area whereas courier B is much better and/or has a depot where you can collect it nearby.
I am proposing a law to be introduced that requires online and other distance selling retailers are required to inform you of the courier/delivery company you will use before you place an order and to be required to give you a choice of two or more.
